title: A categorical semantics for neural networks
author: Charlotte Aten
description: Category theory (multicategories), universal algebra (multiclones), and model theory (structures) for understanding neural networks.

title: Some reflections on the history of connexive logic
author: Sara L. Uckelman
description: Talk on the history of connexive logic

title: The logic of social influence in networks
author: Zoé Christoff
description: This talk gives an introduction to the use of logical tools in understanding social influence and social networks phenomena.

title: Contextual Types, Explained
author: Brigitte Pientka
description: Talk on contextual types

title: Ecumenical systems: from natural deduction with stoup to pure modal systems
author: Elaine Pimentel
description: A talk on an approach adapting Girard’s stoup mechanism to natural deduction.

title: Unveiling the constructive core of classical theories: 90 years of Glivenko’s theorem
author: Sara Negri
description: A talk on Glivenko-style results: results for which classical provability yields intuitionistic provability.

title: Lessons from failing distributive laws
author: Maaike Zwart
description: A talk about the tricky business of composing monads via distributive laws.

title: Randomness and computability theory
author: Johanna Franklin
description: A talk about how computability provides us with a framework for formalizing our intuitions about randomness.

title: The New Era of Formalised Mathematics and the ALEXANDRIA Project
author: Angeliki Koutsoukou Argyraki
description: A talk about the formalisation of mathematics with proof assistants, especially Isabelle.

title: From Computers to Diagrams and Back
author: Gisele Secco
description: A talk about the philosophical aspects of the  formalisation of the 4-color theorem.

title: Thinking about thinking about thinking
author: Rineke Verbrugge
description: A talk about research related to thinking about thinking about thinking.

title: Introduction to bidirectionality
author: Perdita Stevens
description: A talk in the Model-Driven Engineering (MDE) network about biderectional transformations.

title: An algebraic framework to reason about concurrency
author: Alexandra Silva
description: A talk about Kleene algebras with tests (KAT).

title: Information Structures for Privacy and Fairness
author: Catuscia Palamidessi
description: An invited talk FLoC 2022.

title: Inteligência Artificial: Uma evolução tecnológica e intelectual
author: Renata Wassermann
description: Quais são os dilemas éticos e filosóficos associados a Inteligência Artificial?

title: Mathematical Structures in Dependent Type Theory
author: Assia Mahboubi
description: This talk discusses design hierarchies in proof assistants based on dependent type theory.

title: Simple Proofs
author: Rosalie Iemhoff
description: This talk  consists of a collection of observations on the notion of simplicity in the setting of proofs.

title: The Road to Gödel's Incompleteness Theorems
author: Juliette Kennedy
description: This talk  consists of observations about the foundational crisis in Mathematics at the beginning of the 20th century.

title: What is Category Theory in mathematics?
author: Emily Riehl
description: This talk explores the notion of contractibility as uniqueness and its role in generalizing from ordinary categories to infinite-dimensional categories.

title: Differential linear logic extended to differential operators
author: Marie Kerjean
description: Differential Linear Logic adds to linear logic the possibility to linearize non-linear proofs.

title: Combinatorial Properties of the Weisfeiler-Leman Algorithm
author: Sandra Kiefer
description: Discusses state of the art bounds on the ubiquitous Weisfeiler-Leman algorithm for Graph Isomorphism.

title: Introduction to categorical logic, classifying toposes and the «bridge» technique
author: Olivia Caramello
description: First in a four-part course on first-order categorical logic, classifying toposes, and the topos as «bridge» technique.
